subject: Web3
title: EIP-1559: Burning Ether
description: A short lesson to help you apply EIP-1559: Burning Ether.

hook.text: In 2021, Ethereum started burning a portion of every transaction fee. Ether is now sometimes deflationary.

buildup.text: Before EIP-1559, all fees went to miners. The new system splits fees: a base fee is burned, tips go to validators.

discovery.text: When the network is busy, more Ether is burned than created. The total supply actually shrinks.

twist.text: This gave Ether a narrative Bitcoin fans envied: 'ultrasound money' â€” a currency that becomes scarcer over time.

climax.text: Billions of dollars in Ether have been permanently destroyed since the upgrade. Every transaction deletes value.

punchline.text: Every Ethereum transaction burns a little Ether forever.

quiz.question: What does EIP-1559 do?
options: Burns a portion of every transaction fee, reducing Ether supply
